subject: Re: testing private methods
msgSnippet: Hey Dude , do this in setUp( ) ( if Junit3 ) or @Before or whatever if Junit4, if using TestNG use something same ( depends on framework, dont wanna waste your
messageBody:
Hey Dude , do this in setUp( ) ( if Junit3 ) or @Before or whatever if
Junit4, if using TestNG use something same ( depends on framework,
dont wanna waste your time with unnecessary details ) ...

// get all methods in method array
Method[] methods = objectInstance.getClass().getMethods();

// loop through
for(Method aMethod : methods){

if(Modifier.isPublic(aMethod.getModifiers())){

// there you go cowboy :)
aMethod.setAccessible(true);
}

}


if you need further explanation, shoot me an email at
anirudhvyas010@...

Voila you can test all the stuff you want to ...

Regards
Vyas, Anirudh
